newsitem.title: GERMANY: Trinkaus sees satisfactory profit in 97.
newsitem.headline: Trinkaus sees satisfactory profit in 97.

text.p: Germany's Trinkaus & Burkhardt AG, a subsidiary of British bank Midland Bank Plc, said on Wednesday it expected to post a satisfactory profit in 1997.

Herbert Jacobi, the spokesman for the bank's liable partners, told a news conference that he expected a rise in commission income from asset management as well as from its foreign and currency trading businesses.
Own-account trading should also yield a good profit due to rising market volatility while net interest income should "normalise" after rising in previous years, Jacobi said.
Administration costs are expected to rise only moderately depsite the cost of preparing for European monetary union, the bank said.
Earlier Trinkaus reported a 25 percent rise in group net profit in 1996 to 75.5 million marks ($44.1 million).
